cguns.description: 7.62x39mm assault rifle with high initial recoil and high damage over range. A 5.45x39mm magazine attachment is available for a close quarter assault rifle conversion.
5.45x39mm carbine. Trades high accuracy for unpredictable recoil.
5.45x39mm assault rifle. Improved accuracy due to an unique back-and-forth movement of the barrel and bolt carrier upon firing.
9x39mm carbine with an unique built-in suppressor. Improved stealth at the expense of ballistic performance over range.
7.62x39mm assault rifle with a bullpup design. High initial accuracy and an increased magazine size which trade for a high recoil acceleration.
7.62x51mm NATO battle rifle with high close range damage but reduced accuracy and damage at long range.
5.56x45mm assault rifle with a bullpup design. High initial accuracy and long effective range makes it powerful at medium range. Recoil increases as shots are fired.
5.56x45mm assualt rifle with moderate recoil. Damage quickly drops over distance.
7.62x35mm carbine with a high cyclic rate of fire. Its superior ergonimic design allows a faster reaction time at close range.
5.56x45mm assault rifle. Sacrifices damage output for the lowest recoil in class.
7.62x39mm carbine. Has a high accuracy and can be outfitted with numerous muzzle attachemnts to counter its unruly recoil.
5.56x45mm carbine. Provides a relatively long effective range with low recoil.
5.56x45mm assault rifle. Sacrifices damage per shot for a longer barrel and lower recoil. Various barrel attachments avaialble for modifications.
5.56x45mm assault rifle. The three-round burst firing mechanism provides outstanding ballistic performance over range.
7.8x54mm (fictional) battle rifle utilizing built-in recoil reduction mechanism. Fires devastating rounds at a slower cyclic rate of fire.
7.62x35mm carbine, capable of modifying its cyclic rate of fire through a number of barrel attachments, making it a remarkably versatile platform.
5.8x42mm assault rifle with a bullpup design. Has a high cyclic rate of fire as well as high mobility.
7.92x57mm battle rifle with relatively high rate of fire among bolt-action rifles. Compatible with multiple ammo types.
7.62x39mm semi-automatic rifle. Provides high damage output with relatively fast rate of fire. Maintains damage consistency at long range.
7.62x51mm battle rifle. The 7.62x67mm and 8.6x70mm magazine attachments grant varying magnitude of lethality with targets.
9x19mm submachine gun with a bullpup design. 5.56x45mm ammo available for an assault rifle conversion with better ballistic performance at medium and long range.
5.8x21mm personal defense weapon with a bullpup design and a three-round burst firing mechanism. High close range damage output along with a repetitive and predictable recoil on bursts.
5.7x28mm personal defence weapon with a bullpup design. High magazine capacity with an increased hipfire accuracy.
11.43x23mm submachine gun. Highest cyclic rate of fire in class and a moderate accuracy makes it effective at close and medium range.
11.43x23mm submachine gun. Its high damage to the lower body offers it a reltively long effective range.
9x19mm submachine gun. Trades damage output for low recoil.
5.56x30mm personal defense weapon. High rate of fire and mobility makes it extremly effective in close quarter combat. Damage decays quickly over distance.
5.7x28mm personal defence weapon with a bullpup design. An unique high-capacity magazine is fitted on top of the weapon's frame.
9x24mm (fictional) submachine gun with an unique four-round burst firing mechanism. Extremely high damage output per burst at the expense of highly unpreditable recoil.
9x18mm submachine gun with a remarkably high magazine capacity. Lowest recoil in class provides excellent maneverability.

9x19mm submachine gun. High rate of fire and mobility, effective in close quarter combat. A 10x25mm magazine attachment is provided to alleviate its rapidly decaying damage over range at the cost of a slow cyclic rate of fire.
4.6x30mm personal defence weapon. Compact design allows for an ease of use in close and medium range. Very high cyclic rate of fire with an increased magazine size.
5.7x29mm (fictional) personal defence weapon with a bullpup design. High damage output and low recoil offer superior performance at medium range.
5.45x39mm carbine. Increased cartridge size while maintaining recoil and handling, suitable for medium range.
12.7x33mm pistol. Trades high recoil for extremely hard-hitting rounds.
9.1x33mm (fictional) revolver. Higher damage output but less flexibility for modification.
11.43x23mm pistol. Best mobility in class.
9x19mm pistol with a three-round burst firing mechanism. Deals high damage to upper body.
5.56x45mm light machine gun. Has an unique conversion which cannot be aimed down sights. Relatively high recoil.
5.56x45mm light machine gun with very high damage output. Various attachments can drastically improve mobility and handling.
5.56x45mm light machine gun. Attachments can greatly improve mobility at the cost of more recoil.
7.62x39mm light machine gun. Highest damage output at long range in class, great for suppressive fire.
5.8x42mm light machine gun with a bullpup design. Its excellent cyclic rate of fire makes up for the rapidly decaying damage.
5.56x45mm light machine gun with a bullpup design. Decreased damage output but has the highest mobility in class.
12.7x99mm sniper rifle featuring a built-in recoil reduction system. Its semi automatic firing mechanism provides both high damage and fast rate of fire with reduced mobility.
10.36x77mm sniper rifle with moderate maneuverability. Maintains a high lethality at long range.
8.6x70mm sniper rifle with ergonomic and mechanical optimizations. Moderate mobility and rate of fire among bolt-action rifles.
8.6x70mm sniper rifle feeding from a cylinder. Effective at medium range due to a very high rate of fire and mobility.
7.62x51mm designated marksman rifle with semi automatic firing mechanism. Higher rate of fire at the cost of lower damage.

11.43x73mm sniper rifle with unique primer and catalyst rounds utilizing semi automtic firing mechanism. The primers detonate and deal area damage after catalysts hit nearby, making up for the low magazine capacity.
12.7x99mm sniper rifle using semi automatic firing mechanism. Deals high damage to the head with an increased rate of fire.
18.570mm shotgun using fully automatic firing mechanism. Various magazine attachments are available.
18.570mm shotgun. Reduced damage per pellet for better performance over range.
18.570mm shotgun in lever action. Increased the number of pellets per shot at the cost of more pellet spread and slower rate of fire.
18.570mm shotgun with a bullpup design and a four-round burst firing mechanism. Uses an unique quad-tube revolver magazine.
18.570mm shotgun. Designed for close quarter combat with high damage but a slightly reduced rate of fire.
18.570mm shotgun utilizing fully automatic firing mechanism. High damage output but has a much slower reload speed.
